SEARCH
Package cycling

Class Result

java.lang.Object
cycling.Result
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Result>
public class Result extends Object implements Comparable<Result>, Serializable
Represents the result of a rider in a race, storing stage times, total time, and points.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Olly Johnson and Laith Al Qudah
See Also:

    • toString

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Result other)
      Compares this result with another to order them by total adjusted elapsed time.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Result>
      Parameters:
      other - The other result to compare to.
      Returns:
      A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this result is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified result.

    • hasStageResult

      public boolean hasStageResult(int stageId)
      Checks if there is a result stored for a stage.
      Parameters:
      stageId - The ID of the stage.
      Returns:
      true if the stage has a stage result in this overall result, false otherwise

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if this result has any stages associated with it.
      Returns:
      true if the Result doesn't have any StageResults, false otherwise.
